data.title: How to show icon button in editor menu bar?
Same file opened twice from network drive

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.1 (27492b6bf3acb0775d82d2f87b25a93490673c6d, 2017-09-14T16:38:09.760Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063


Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a network drive as the project root
2. Press Ctrl+P and select a file, which opens it in a tab
3. Use the side bar explorer panel to open the same file

This opens two copies of the same file, instead of just one.
Note also that right-clicking on the file's tab and choosing "Reveal in side bar" does not work for the file opened in step 1, but does work for the file opened in step 2.

This happens when the project root is a SAMBA share on a Linux machine, mapped as a network drive on Windows.  It does not appear to be due to case sensitivity problems.

This issue causes work to be lost, as changes made in one edit window overwrite changes made in the other edit window when saving.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: File Icon Theme not applied correctly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.1 (27492b6bf3acb0775d82d2f87b25a93490673c6d, 2017-09-14T16:24:39.530Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
material-icon-theme|PKi|2.2.1
python|don|0.7.0
vscode-great-icons|emm|2.1.16
vscode-ghc-mod|hoo|1.2.0
language-haskell|jus|2.3.2
cpptools|ms-|0.12.4

(1 theme extensions excluded)


---

The issue doesn't seem to be reproducible for anybody else. I have tried reinstalling the icon themes as well as vscode itself, without success. The problem is that some icons (in my case the Haskell file icon) is not displayed correctly. Instead, some other haskell icon is being used (that I don't know). See [this issue](https://github.com/PKief/vscode-material-icon-theme/issues/134#event-1256854834) to verify that this is not a bug in the theme itself.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install VSCode Material Icon Theme
2. Open a folder containing a haskell file using VSCode
3. The wrong haskell icon is displayed in place of the one provided by the installed theme.

It seems like the image cache is corrupted in some way. While this is not a serious bug, it seems weird nevertheless. Note that only the VSCode Material Icon Theme is not working as expected, any other theme works normally.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: No, as the issue is directly linked to theme extensions.

data.title: Search: collapse but keep roots expanded

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
One pattern I am seeing myself doing a lot is invoking the "Collapse" action on the search viewlet and now that I have multi root results, I see no results until I expand a root:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/30634559-ce368a68-9def-11e7-91c5-1b3e75112aa8.png)

Could we maybe collapse all but leave the roots expanded? Or, upon first collapse call we do that and upon the second we collapse also the roots?

data.title: Set git.autofetch to disabled, by default
data.body:
Git autofetch makes auth popups come up on many users' machines. These popups come out of nowhere and don't indicate that their existence is due to Code spawning `git fetch`. AFAIK it is not possible to detect whether a `git fetch` will cause a popup to appear, since it depends on the user's configuration.

Many users have already expressed their will to have autofetch disabled by default simply because such a default enabled setting is _too magic_.

Furthermore, I keep getting ~10 issues per iteration in which I have to, yet again, explain the nature of the mysterious popup to surprised users.

I intend to disable autofetch by default due to this. The consequence is, of course, that the incoming changes won't be automatically updated any more by default, unless you enable the setting.

We can also introduce a one-time popup which prompts the user if he wants to enable autofetch in case a successful sync has happened, which is a good sign that proper credentials are configured.

@Microsoft/vscode, thoughts?

data.title: Snippet transformations for placeholders

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: This is a follow up item for https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/6920 which implemented snippet transformation for *variables*. This issue tracks the remainder which is transforms for placeholders. Unfortunately they are much harder to implement, as today snippet controller uses multi-cursor-math for insertion and multi-cursors are defined to always insert the same text everywhere.

6. Your text selection is gone.

data.title: Tab in Search field in Replace in Files should focus Replace field
data.body:
And shift-tab in the Replace field should then move the focus back to the Search field. This is the tab focus behavior in the Edit > Replace fields. This would enable rapidly doing many different replacements by tabbing and shift-tabbing between the Search and Replace fields.

data.title: Ctrl+Shift+ \ doesn't page down to matching bracket
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.1 (27492b6bf3acb0775d82d2f87b25a93490673c6d, 2017-09-14T16:38:23.027Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
cform|aws|0.0.10
githistory|don|0.2.3
terraform|mau|0.0.17

Not sure if this is a bug or not, but since upgrading to v1.16 I've noticed that the Go to Bracket keybinding will mark the matching bracket but it does not page down to that bracket.  I've checked shortcut settings and it is indeed listed as a shortcut.  I just updated to v1.16.1 but the problem still persists.  If it is not a bug and instead some sort of setting I need to change please let me know.

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Highlight a curly bracket then hit Ctrl+Shift+\ 
2.  Typically the page would jump to the matching bracket and in my case it no longer does.

Thanks for the help.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Fix raw update-available event emitting on Windows
data.body: Raw updater on Windows emit  `update-available` event without payload,  and the event will be ignored by [updateService](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/platform/update/electron-main/updateService.ts#L65), thus the checkForUpdate promise will be blocked until the installer file downloaded. This behavior is not consist with the Linux one.

data.title: Fix the behavious of Git Credential Manager for Windows Popups
data.body:
There is already an issue about this 
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/33313
Why closed?

I don't think it is a good behaviour,   

1. first, you should tell user this popup is pop by vscode (I cost some time to find out this)
2. you should show the `git remote -v` at popup top, then user can know which account to login (it is necessary when user has many account. )
3. Now, no error message for wrong Credential , even more, it would popup again and again after close, 
are you kidding me?Click close button means user don't want to use vscode to manage git in this project   , keeping popup is a really bad and annoying behavious .

Please fix it!
